title: Nick Tilsley actor Ben Price reveals details of Coronation Street exit - and where he's going next
text:
Get soaps   Thank you for subscribing!   
Coronation Street viewers are well aware Ben Price has quit his role of Nick Tilsley after seven years. 
Nick has just become father to Leanne Battersby’s baby - although not blood-related, seeing as it’s actually Steve McDonald’s child. 
And now, Ben has revealed details of Nick’s exit, which he’s decided to do to spend more time with his family. 
Speaking to Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield on This Morning , he said: “It’s going to be in a few months time-ish. Read More Ben Price revealed details of his Corrie exit (Photo: ITV/This Morning) Ben Price has played Nick for 7 years (Photo: ITV) Ben is leaving for his family (Photo: ITV/This Morning) 
“I don’t know how it ends. Kate Oates asked if I wanted to know, but I said, ‘Don’t tell me!’. 
“I want them to decide. It’s their show, so I want whatever serves the show best.” 
Ben also explained why he’s chosen to leave Corrie and what he’s going on to do after. 
He said: “I’m going to leave for my family. 
“It’s been amazing, I’ve loved the show, worked with amazing people and had amazing storylines. Read More He has no idea what's going to happen to Nick (Photo: ITV/This Morning) He doesn't want to know! (Photo: ITV/This Morning) 
“But my family live 200 miles away so I see my wife and child on a Saturday. 
“I’ll be making paper mache, talking to my kids, taking them to school. 
“I’ll leave one family and gain my real one back.”
